alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 2:20PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Laramie County through 245 PM MDT... At 219 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Warren AFB, or 7 miles west of Cheyenne, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, South Greeley, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, Warren Af Base, Ranchettes, Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 345 and 371. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
